Problem Statement: All participating teams are required to compete using a completely autonomous robot that follows a line (in the form of tape) that extends from a given start point to an end point.
Arena Specifications: The arena consists of a black insulation tape of width 3 cm pasted on a white flex sheet background. A simple sample of the arena is shown below only for illustrational purposes. The actual arena may or may not differ drastically from the arena depicted here. The arena would be at least 2m x 2m in dimension. The path may include straight lines, gradual or sharp bends, ramps sloped at 30 degrees, intersections, loops and short breaks in line. Some of these items may be excluded but no additional items will be included. Breaks, if any, will be 3 cm in length. The start point is a black circle of diameter 25 cm. The end point is a back square of side 25 cm.
Robot specifications: The robot should fit into a box of dimensions 25 cm x 25 cm. The voltage between any two points within the robot may not exceed 12 V. The robot should have an LED or a buzzer to give an indication for 3 seconds when it reaches the end point. The robot may be wired or wireless.
